title: Brazilian regulator approves Enel tender offer for Eletropaulo shares: filing
text:
FILE PHOTO: The new logo of Italy's biggest utility Enel is seen inside its flagship store in downtown Milan, Italy, May 4, 2018. REUTERS/Stefano Rellandini

SAO PAULO (Reuters) - Brazilian securities regulator CVM has approved Italian utility Enel’s (ENEI.MI) tender offer to acquire all shares issued by power distribution firm Eletropaulo Metropolitana (ELPL3.SA), the Brazilian company said in a filing late on Thursday.

Enel, which acquired Eletropaulo last year for around $1.5 billion, aims to purchase a remaining 4.1% stake to delist the company.
description: Brazilian securities regulator CVM has approved Italian utility Enel's tender offer to acquire all shares issued by power distribution firm Eletropaulo Metropolitana , the Brazilian company said in a filing late on Thursday.
